translation.ja: あいつは犯罪者だが人は殺してない 一時帰宅させれば

translation.en: Lady Governor would have to sign for it.
I'd wager she's not too happy about us expanding our jurisdiction.
translation.ja: 俺たちの強引な捜査をよく思ってない

translation.en: I'm just saying.
Maney.
Bonnie Parker.
I've seen ten of 'em today.
Yeah, it's the...
translation.ja: 同じ格好で見分けがつかん

translation.en: -It's the fashion. -All the rage.
translation.ja: 同じ格好で見分けがつかん 流行りか

translation.en: -Where you going? -Nature calls.
Jiminy Christmas. You just went!
-Get in the picture, now! -Bonnie and Clyde!
It's them, around the corner!
Grab a shotgun.
I'm gonna back us out of here. Come on.
They parked in the back. One of 'em went in.
Wasn't Ray Hamilton, neither. It was Henry Methvin,
translation.ja: ３人目はヘンリー･メスバンだ

translation.en: -the third man in the jailbreak. -I know, I saw him. You let him go?
translation.ja: ３人目はヘンリー･メスバンだ 逃したのか？

translation.en: Well, I had my eye on Clyde.
Clyde? You had your-- You had your eye on Clyde? You had a shot?
translation.ja: それならなぜクライドを仕留めない？

translation.en: Why didn't you take him?
Too many people. Goddamn fan club.
translation.ja: ファンの連中が邪魔だ

translation.en: Damn.
Right there!
I can't see 'em!
Yeah.
They stopped for a nice breakfast this morning.
French toast and coffee.
Clyde ordered himself a soft-boiled egg off the à la carte menu.
translation.ja: クライドは半熟卵を注文した

translation.en: Cute little diner in Amarillo.
-Amarillo? -Yeah.
Clyde drove 400 miles last night?
Four hundred and fifty.
Do you ever think, maybe...
Maybe it ain't in us no more?
He got through a thousand-man dragnet to deliver a bunny to Momma.
translation.ja: 千人規模の捜査網を抜けてウサギを届けに来たか

translation.en: What do we do now?
I just had the one idea.
Pancho!
Thank you, sir.
They tell me you're from the highway department, but...
translation.ja: 交通警察だと聞いたが―

translation.en: I know who you really are.
I know a killer when I see one.
I'm sure you would, Mr. Barrow.
Look, mister.
I know y'all are gonna have to kill my boy.
translation.ja: 息子を殺すなとは言わない

translation.en: It ain't your fault.
He's gone past the point of redemption.
translation.ja: もう取り返しがつかない

translation.en: There's something I wanna say.
Here.
He wasn't born that way.
He wasn't born with no dark soul.
translation.ja: 生まれつきの悪人じゃない

translation.en: My little Huck Finn.
That's what me and Cumie called him.
He loved bicycles.
What he really wanted to be was a musician.
I mean, sure, he liked to dress fine and get the girls and all like that, but it...
translation.ja: 服装が派手で女好きだったが―

translation.en: You know, he wasn't a bad boy.
I had high hopes.
People don't always know who they are... until it's too late.
translation.ja: 本性に気づくのが― 遅すぎた

translation.en: Oh, you mean one turn on the trail, huh?
translation.ja: きっかけなら あったとも

translation.en: That what you mean?
He stole a chicken.
He stole a goddamn chicken, mister,
and the law took him for a bad seed. And from that day forward,
translation.ja: それ以来警察に目をつけられて―

translation.en: he was dogged by the law.
-Dogged him? -Yes, sir!
Dogged or watched him?
I guess it's all the same to you. You're a cop.
translation.ja: おたくら警察には同じか

translation.en: Yes, I am.
Growing up all I ever…
-All I ever wanted to be was a preacher. -Preacher?
You expect me to believe that?
I was saving up for the seminary.
Working for a sharecropper in San Saba.
translation.ja: サンサバの農場で働いてた

translation.en: Word got out that I was pretty handy with a pistol.
translation.ja: 俺の射撃の腕を聞きつけた農場主のマクスウェインに―

translation.en: The owner, McSwain, called me up to the porch one day and wanted to know
translation.ja: 俺の射撃の腕を聞きつけた農場主のマクスウェインに― 150ドル稼ぐ気はないかと持ちかけられた

translation.en: if I wanted to make $150.
translation.ja: 150ドル稼ぐ気はないかと持ちかけられた

translation.en: I laughed and said, “Who do I have to kill?”
translation.ja: 誰を殺すのかと冗談で聞くと―

translation.en: And he kept staring at me.
That's when I knew...
he wasn't talking about killing a coyote or a polecat.
translation.ja: 標的はコヨーテでもスカンクでもない―

translation.en: He was talking about his business partner he wanted dead.
translation.ja: 奴の共同経営者だった

translation.en: I told him I was gonna... tell his business partner.
translation.ja: 俺は本人にバラすと言った

translation.en: That wasn't too smart.
Well, I was 16!
Like I said, I was saving up for the seminary.
translation.ja: それに神学校を目指してた

translation.en: Couple weeks later, he... asked me to put some groceries in his house.
translation.ja: 数週間後 奴の家に食料品を運び入れてた時だ

translation.en: Before I could go in, he pulled a scattergun.
translation.ja: 奴は散弾銃を取り出して

translation.en: Shot me in my head... my back... and my leg.
translation.ja: 俺の頭と背中と足を撃ちやがった

translation.en: For whatever reasons I still don't know, he stepped right over me and went inside.
translation.ja: それから俺をまたいで家の中へ消えた

translation.en: Maybe to reload. I don't know, but I...
translation.ja: 弾を取りに行ったんだろう

translation.en: I scrambled away. Hid in an irrigation ditch.
translation.ja: 俺は必死に逃げて用水路に隠れた

translation.en: I would've died there, except for a colored field hand... came along, found me,
translation.ja: 畑仕事の黒人が見つけてくれなけりゃ―

translation.en: carried me home. My momma took care of me all summer.
translation.ja: 死んでたよ 母が看病した

translation.en: Come fall, I...
I packed up for the seminary. At least, that's what I told 'em.
translation.ja: 神学校へ行くと言って荷物をまとめて家を出た

translation.en: And on my way out of town, I rode over to McSwain's.
translation.ja: マクスウェインの家に寄り―

translation.en: Rang the yard bell. He came out.
And I shot that son of a bitch dead, right there on that same porch.
translation.ja: そして出てきたところを撃ち殺した

translation.en: And there went my calling.
Turned out, McSwain was a wanted man himself...
translation.ja: 奴が手配犯だと判明し―

translation.en: and I became the law.
One turn on the trail, huh?
Yes, sir. One turn.
How come you're telling me all this?
You ever think maybe there was something in Clyde...
that made him steal that chicken in the first place?
Maybe he was hungry.
Maybe we were all hungry.
I won't argue that.
He ain't gonna surrender.
You're just gonna hang him anyhow.
He'd rather be brought down on the run.
translation.ja: 捕まるくらいなら死ぬ覚悟だ

translation.en: You know, your boy may not have been... born with a dark soul, but he has one now.
translation.ja: 昔は違っても― 今やクライドは立派な悪人だ

translation.en: You're not hearing me, mister.
I'm trying to say something. It ain't easy for me to say.
translation.ja: こんなこと言うのはつらいが…

translation.en: I know there's only one way that this thing is ever gonna end.
translation.ja: 終わらせ方は一つしかないだろう

translation.en: And I'm asking you, please...
just end it now, damn it.
End it for my family.
You call Lee Simmons. Get him to furlough Wade McNabb.
translation.ja: リーに電話してマクナブを一時帰宅させる

translation.en: What a fine idea.
I couldn't believe it when Billy Mays said he was letting you out.
translation.ja: 釈放って聞いて驚いたわ

translation.en: Sixty days. And if I get a job and I do good behavior in that time, it could be full parole.
translation.ja: 60日以内に就職して大人しくしてりゃ仮釈放だ

translation.en: But it ain't good behavior I got on my mind tonight.
My kind of place.
How are you, darling?
So, is it true? Do you really know Clyde Barrow?
I knew his brother Buck, too, before they shot him dead.
What are we gonna do with you?
-I can think of a few things, darling. -Oh yeah?
Good to be off the farm, Wade?
-They wouldn't tell me your name. -Don't need it.
translation.ja: 名を聞いてない 必要ない

translation.en: I dig.
Say you order me a do-over, slick.
Or not.
Where's the water closet?
So what do y'all need me to do?
Say, you bringing the cattle to market, Dad?
translation.ja: 牛でも売りに行くのか？

translation.en: I swear, big man.
They're planning to skin out for Mexico. That is the word. What do you know, Joe?
translation.ja: メキシコに高飛びする気だ さすがだぜ

translation.en: Son, suppose you cut the junior gangster act and get serious.
translation.ja: ギャングごっこは終わりだ

translation.en: Otherwise, there's nothing you can do for me.
I'll have Lee Simmons give you a ride back to the farm tonight.
translation.ja: 今夜ムショに戻りたいか？

translation.en: Yes, sir.
Let me tell you something, mister.
You come to the wrong place to dog Wade-Boy.
That's right, old man.
You see, Wade-Boy runs with Clyde.
translation.ja: マクナブはクライドのダチだ

translation.en: And around here, Clyde is king.
translation.ja: ここはクライドが仕切ってる

translation.en: Watch those fancy shoes.
It's a real mess, you get it point-blank, but I'm happy to do it for you.
translation.ja: 撃つと掃除が大変だが俺は構わんぞ

translation.en: A lot of nerve you got, trying to... rob a fella while he's having himself a pleasant relief.
translation.ja: 俺の小便中に襲うとはずいぶんと見上げた度胸だ

translation.en: Get in that stall.
Stay in there till I come back and tell you different.
translation.ja: 俺がいいというまで入ってろ

translation.en: Clyde might be king, but I'm a Texas Ranger, you little shit.
translation.ja: テキサス･レンジャーをナメんなよ

translation.en: Billie Mace is set to fix Bonnie's hair.
-When? -Tomorrow. Dinnertime.
translation.ja: いつ？ 明日 夕食時に

translation.en: Might look like two girls. Sometimes Clyde wears a wig.
translation.ja: クライドは女装してるかも

translation.en: -He got y'all chasing your own tails. -Son, if you're telling the truth...
translation.ja: 苦戦してますね 本当だったら―

translation.en: you'll finish out your term in a nice, civilized federal pen.
translation.ja: 快適な刑務所に移してやる

translation.en: But you do wrong by me, you'll be back on the farm, breaking rocks...
translation.ja: ウソならキツい労働に逆戻りだ

translation.en: and getting your teeth stove-in.
What took you so long?
There's a fella in the toilet.
Are you Billie Mace?
You must be Billy Mace.
Hey, Granddad.
Wanna race again?
Didn't your momma teach you to tie your shoes?
translation.ja: 靴ひも ほどけてるぞ

translation.en: -We gonna see each other again? -No, sir.
translation.ja: 二度とするな はい

translation.en: Git!
"Git." Downright poetic.
"Headed for greener pastures.
See you next time around."
McNabb warned 'em.
McNabb! Open up the goddamn door!
Goddamn animals.
Did I get that boy killed?
No, sir.
You did not.
He would have been out in nine months on his own.
translation.ja: あと９か月で釈放だった

translation.en: Fella did not... have to die.
translation.ja: 殺されることもなかった

translation.en: Maybe so, but that fella made his own choices.
See, Frank...
that's the difference right there between you and me.
translation.ja: それがお前と俺の違いだよ

translation.en: You could always hide...
translation.ja: お前は いつもそうだ

translation.en: behind some notion of right and wrong.
translation.ja: 悪党なら死んでいいと思ってる

translation.en: Me, I never particularly liked the weight...
translation.ja: 悪党なら死んでいいと思ってる 俺は お前みたいに割り切れない

translation.en: of the deciding who gets to live and who doesn't.
translation.ja: 俺は お前みたいに割り切れない 人の生死を左右してるんだ

translation.en: There's differences between us, Maney,
but hiding behind something ain't one of 'em.
translation.ja: だが違いはそこじゃない

translation.en: You know, counting McNabb, they've killed 13.
And people call 'em heroes.
-Who cares what they call-- -I care!
translation.ja: だから何だ 気に入らん

translation.en: People idolize them. We need to end this.
translation.ja: 殺人鬼に憧れるなど言語道断だ

translation.en: It's never easy, it's never pretty,
translation.ja: きれい事では済まされない

translation.en: but there's always blood at the end of the road, you know that.
translation.ja: 血が流れるのは避けられない

translation.en: You know that the same as me.
I seen a lot a blood... but it ain't theirs.
translation.ja: それが罪のない人の血でもか？

translation.en: Goddamnit, Maney, why the hell…
Why the hell you even come?
I had to come.
Though I don't exactly know why.
translation.ja: なぜ来たのか分からない

translation.en: It's gonna look like we set McNabb up to be killed.
If Ma finds out...
I don't think I can protect you or myself.
You need to come back to Austin so we can sort this out.
translation.ja: とりあえず戻ってこい

translation.en: I understand, Lee.
If you're ready to go home, I'll drive you.
Take me to greener pastures.
I'll just get a bottle and sit there and wait for Clyde to show up.
translation.ja: 酒でも飲みながら待ち伏せするかな

translation.en: Does that mean anything, you think? "Headed for greener pastures."
Is he headed for a state he hasn't hit yet?
Could be.
What states have warrants for him?
No, better still, what states don't?
translation.ja: いや 出てない州はどこだ？

translation.en: New Mexico...
Colorado,
Louisiana.
Outlaws always go home.
Maybe we just been looking at the wrong home.
translation.ja: 違う根城が あるのか

translation.en: Methvin, where's he from?
-Kansas. -He still have family there?
No, his dad...
lives in Bienville Parish. East of Shreveport.
translation.ja: 今はルイジアナのビエンビル郡だ

translation.en: Owner lets folk squat in exchange for labor.
translation.ja: オーナーが住み込みで働かせてる

translation.en: Henry's daddy hauls wood for 'em.
That's his truck.
Ivy Methvin.
They're playing house.
She's a little bitty thing.
So's he.
You all right?
Fix the room back.
Probably best they weren't home. We got no jurisdiction to arrest in these parts.
translation.ja: 鉢合わせても逮捕する権限がない

translation.en: Now, we weren't there to arrest them, Maney.
Well, then I suggest we bring in a local sheriff next time.
translation.ja: 次は保安官を連れていくんだな

translation.en: Okay, what if he's in on the hand?
A corrupt sheriff down this way isn't exactly remarkable.
translation.ja: 保安官の買収は珍しくない

translation.en: One way to find out.
You said you seen Clyde.
Yes, sir.
Where? North Highway?
-Most recently, two miles from-- -How do you know it him?
translation.ja: 直近は… 確かなのか？

translation.en: My name is... Flavius Kern.
translation.ja: 私の名前はフラビウス･カーン

translation.en: I am the Barrow family parson. May I?
translation.ja: 私の名前はフラビウス･カーン バロウ家の牧師です

translation.en: Now, nobody knows I'm here, and you never saw me.
translation.ja: 私と会ったことはどうか内密に

translation.en: But, the family is grateful to you
translation.ja: バロウ一家は保安官殿に感謝しています

translation.en: because the kids, they're good kids. They're...
translation.ja: 例の２人はとても良い子たちでして…

translation.en: They got in a little over their heads, but word is there's some heat on 'em down here.
translation.ja: ただ 少しやりすぎて追跡が厳しくなっているとか

translation.en: And I know you never saw 'em, and you never heard they was
translation.ja: ただ 少しやりすぎて追跡が厳しくなっているとか この郡に彼らはいないということで―

translation.en: in your parish, and we'd like to keep it that way.
translation.ja: この郡に彼らはいないということで― お願いします

translation.en: Clyde will try to show his appreciation to you, but the family...
translation.ja: クライドもいずれ感謝を示すでしょうが

translation.en: would like to show theirs.
Call it a contribution to the parish church.
translation.ja: 教区協会への寄付ということで

translation.en: Now, I won't take up any more of your time.
Your boy use a shotgun on that gator or...
No, we used a gig, like this here.
Listen to me, papere. I see the dogs in Bienville, I'll shoot 'em dead.
translation.ja: この郡で奴らを見たら撃ち殺す

translation.en: Take your bribe and go home, or I'll shoot your ass, too.
translation.ja: 死にたくなきゃ賄賂を持って失せろ

translation.en: We're not crooks here.
Well, then, you are just the gentlemen we're looking for.
translation.ja: なら ぴったりの人材だ

translation.en: Timber!
Mr. Ivy.
Some men over there looking for somebody to cut and haul wood.
translation.ja: 木こりを探してるって人が来てます

translation.en: Say they pay fair.
You need some more hands, me and my boy, we needs the work.
translation.ja: 何かあれば手が空いてますんで

translation.en: Work right here. Get to it.
translation.ja: なら これやっとけ

translation.en: -What the hell is this? -I'm Sheriff Jordan.
translation.ja: 何事だ 保安官のジョーダンだ

translation.en: -This is my deputy, Mr. Oakley. -Well, who are you fellas?
translation.ja: 保安官のジョーダンだ そっちは？

translation.en: Doesn't concern you.
All you need to know is Bonnie and Clyde are going down hard, Mr. Methvin.
translation.ja: ボニーとクライドの命は無い

translation.en: If not by the gun, then by the chair.
-And your boy Henry is going with them. -My boy didn't kill nobody.
translation.ja: ヘンリーもだ 息子は何も

translation.en: Killed a highway patrolman near Grapevine, Texas.
translation.ja: テキサスで交通警官を射殺した

translation.en: We have a witness, ballistics, and the whole book.
translation.ja: 目撃者もいるし証拠もある

translation.en: Wiretaps.
We know they're gonna be coming to see you. We're gonna give your son a chance to live.
translation.ja: ヘンリーの命を救う方法が一つある

translation.en: How?
Well, he's gonna have to put 'em on the spot. He does, we'll put him on the ground, instead of in it.
translation.ja: 奴らを殺す手引きをすれば助けてやる

translation.en: -Meaning you'll let him go? -As far as Texas is concerned, yes, sir.
translation.ja: 見逃すと？ テキサスとしてはな

translation.en: They might be by in a day or two.
When you get your boy alone, you tell him to get separated first chance he gets.
translation.ja: 隙を見て奴らと離れるように伝えろ

translation.en: -They'll come right back to see him. -We'll be waiting.
translation.ja: 会いにくる 待ち伏せする

translation.en: -Why should I trust you? -Because I said.
translation.ja: 信用しろと？ 当然だ

translation.en: That's just how he's built.
Well, they got a rule.
If they get separated, they wait a couple days
translation.ja: 分かれたら― 念のため数日待ってうちで合流する

translation.en: for the air to clear and then meet up back at my house.
translation.ja: 念のため数日待ってうちで合流する

translation.en: Clyde won't be taken alive.
Neither will your boy, sir, unless he takes his one chance now.
translation.ja: このチャンスを逃せばヘンリーも殺されるぞ

translation.en: I like my house.
-Excuse me? -I like my house!
translation.ja: 家？ 壊されたくない

translation.en: Clyde bought it for me, and I don't want y'all shooting it up.
translation.ja: クライドが買ってくれた

translation.en: They'll be around for Henry. There ain't but one way in, one way out. That's Ringgold Road.
translation.ja: うちへの出入りはリンゴールド通りだけ

translation.en: Ringgold Road.
Once my boy gets clear, you... Well, you can kill 'em there.
translation.ja: 息子が離れたらそこで殺せばいいだろ

translation.en: All right.
Take two.
Looks like we're outnumbered by Texans, Henderson.
Well, we need these Dallas boys, the only ones who can make a positive identification.
translation.ja: こいつらしか連中の顔を知らないからな

translation.en: Old Ivy said that car's loaded with firepower.
They got machine guns, hand grenades, a thousand rounds of shells.
translation.ja: 武器が満載してあるらしい

translation.en: It's an armory on four wheels.
-Well, we'll find out. -Gonna have us a hunt.
translation.ja: へえ 狩りに行ける

translation.en: Gonna skin us some deer.
Dang, if I don't have an Arkansas Straight.
Dallas paper gave me a camera to film it when it happens.
translation.ja: 新聞社に撮影を頼まれました

translation.en: Said he'd pay me. Can y'all believe that?
What the hell is this world coming to?
-Well, there we go. -Three sevens?
Maybe we should put six bills in the pot, homme. Make it interesting.
translation.ja: 次はカネ賭けてやるか

translation.en: No. Cap says no money in the game, nor drinking on Sundays.
translation.ja: カネを賭けるのも日曜に飲むのも― ダメだってよ

translation.en: Can't be much fun.
Yeah, well, there's a place for me in heaven, I'll tell you that.
translation.ja: そのお陰で天国に行ける

translation.en: What's he doing out there?
He likes to be alone sometimes.
Sheriff Smoot said you and Hamer killed more than 50 men between you.
translation.ja: ２人で50人以上殺したと聞きました

translation.en: Killed more than that in one evening.
I didn't mean to pry.
It's all right, kid. Ante up, gents.
translation.ja: 気にすんな チップ出しな

translation.en: I was young. Younger than you.
translation.ja: お前よりも若いころの話さ

translation.en: South Texas, a place called Candelario.
translation.ja: キャンデラリアの町で―

translation.en: Ranger Company C. Had about 60 bandits pinned down in a dry wash.
translation.ja: レンジャーのＣ中隊が60人の賊を拘束した

translation.en: These fellas burned half a dozen ranches, killed a dozen...
translation.ja: ６つの農場を焼き10人ほど殺して―

translation.en: and raped just about as many.
Anyway, every time we'd ride in there
translation.ja: 現場に乗り込むときは―

translation.en: to take 'em, we'd yell out, "Manos arribas."
translation.ja: “手を挙げろ(マノス･アリバス)”と警告する

translation.en: You know, "Hands up."
Well, they'd...
translation.ja: だが奴らは構わず撃つ

translation.en: fire on us, and we'd lose a man. Went on like that for two days.
translation.ja: だが奴らは構わず撃つ だから仲間が死んでく

translation.en: So they sent down... young Captain Hamer,
translation.ja: そこへ現れたのがハマー隊長だ

translation.en: my friend Pancho.
Cap says... "What's going on down here?"
translation.ja: 隊長は俺たちに状況をたずねた

translation.en: "Any time we yell out, 'manos arribas,' like the law tells us to...
translation.ja: 法律を守ってスペイン語で警告すると―

translation.en: they open up on us."
Cap says, “We're going in there afore dawn and, this time,
